717917f-c.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park - East Center
717917f-c.text:
(1)
Demolition of the Federal Hall replica, Bryant Park, east-center, the New York Public Libary in the background, the year after
the George Washington Bicentennial Celebration.
The skyscrapers seen on the roof of the Library are, from left to right: the Chrysler Building, the Lincoln Building, the Lefcourt Colonial Building on Madison Avenue and the much smaller Farmers Loan & Trust Building on Fifth Avenue, and finally the New York Trust Company Building.
April 24, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
717917f-c.folder: Bryant Park & East Center, Manhattan, NY

717923f-b.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Northwestern quarter).
717923f-b.text:
(1)
Bryant Park, northwestern quarter, seen from the rear of the New York Public Library, showing the Park under reconstruction.
April 30, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, a later stage of the reconstruction carried out under
Park Commissioner Robert Moses.
August 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same, another view.
August 11, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

717932f-b.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Southeastern corner).
717932f-b.text:
(1)

Bryant Park, S.E. corner, showing the Outdoor-Library located in this corner by the Extension Division of the New York Public Library; named by the W.P.A.

August 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

A close up of the Librarians table with open racks alongside.  This unit maintains a very informal service and has been highly popular.

August 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

717932f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Southeastern corner).

717915f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park
717915f-a.text:
(1)
Bryant Park: A view of the Open--Air Library of the Extension Division of the New York Public Library located in the S.E. corner. This scene shows several readers and a librarian at the periodical rack at the foot of the Goethe bust.
Fall 1936.
Gift of Geo. D. Chinn.
(2)
The librarian's table; a centre of this informal and highly
popular unit.
Fall 1936.
Gift of Geo. D. Chinn.

717915f-b.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park
717915f-b.text:

717907f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park
717907f-a.text:
Bryant Park: The fountain in the Western portion as overshadowed by the huge 500 Fifth Avenue Building. Adjacent to same is the secondary Salmon Tower with the still lower (former) Aeolian Hall. To the right and forming the Fifth Avenue frontage is the
New York Public Library.
Augst 5, 1938.
P. L. Sperr

717914f-a.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park - Street Scenes
717914f-a.text:
Street Scenes: Bryant Park provides the setting for this
lovely scene.
Norris Engel  1941
717914f-a.folder: Bryant Park & Street Scenes, Manhattan, NY

717924f-b.title: Manhattan: Bryant Park (Northwestern corner) - New York Public Library during reconstruction of the park under Commissioner Robert Moses.
717924f-b.text:
(1)
Bryant Park, northwestern quarter, seen from the rear of the New York Public Library, during the reconstruction of the Park under Commissioner Robert Moses.

March 15, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing the progress of the work five months later.

August 11, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, showing work completed. Note the 42nd Street station (on the right) of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.

August 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
717924f-b.folder: Bryant Park (Northwestern corner) & New York Public Library during reconstruction of the park under Commissioner Robert Moses., Manhattan, NY
